stories.text:
Can you share your experiences with available affordable solutions for video hosting user generated content?

This content is mainly screen recordings of mobile game play.

I have explored few and here are my observations

1. Cloud Flare Stream -> Priced based on minutes streamed and stored irrespective of the bandwidth/video quality.

2. AWS Media services -> This may go costly as CloudFront is costly comparitively

3. Mux -> Pricing nearly equal to Cloud Flare and priced based on streaming time

4. Bunny.net stream -> Charged only for streaming and encoding free - Not sure how much difference it gives

5. Dyntube.com -> Boast unlimited streaming for lowest prices but not sure about the service

The use-case I have is more like there can be limited videos and cost need to be optimised for streaming.

Can someone suggest a good option?
stories.title: Video Hosting Services Available for User Generated Content
